name: Covie
headline: Programmatic building blocks for transacting with insurance
description:
Interacting with insurance across a variety of carriers should be undifferentiated heavy lifting - a piece of infrastructure like Stripe, Twilio, or AWS that "just works"in the background while your business focuses on what makes it different. We provide programmatic building blocks to make this a reality, putting a carrier-neutral API and tooling on top of insurance, starting with policy access (think Plaid, but for your insurance company) and monitoring.

Our technology has a variety of use cases that range from insurance verification and tracking, financial advising, compliance & risk management, and marketing/distribution of insurance products.

**Covie: Simplifying Insurance Transactions**

Covie, a fintech startup based in Austin, Texas, is on a mission to revolutionize the way businesses interact with insurance. Founded in 2020 and part of the Y Combinator Batch S21, Covie builds programmatic tools that make transactions with various insurance carriers effortless—think of it as the Stripe or Twilio of the insurance world.

### What They Do
Covie provides a carrier-neutral API that wraps complex insurance interactions into simple, programmatic building blocks. Their technology streamlines functions like insurance verification, tracking, compliance, and marketing of insurance products. They are all about integrating insurance data into your existing applications without hassle. Their products currently include:

- **Access**: Get details on policy limits and coverage.
- **Monitor**: Receive updates when there are changes in policy status or limits.

Covie positions itself as the background infrastructure—allowing companies to focus on what makes them unique while leveraging the heavy lifting that Covie does.

### Who They Serve
Covie's solutions are intended for a variety of stakeholders, including agents and financial advisors, making it easier to incorporate insurance products into their services. By automating verification and monitoring, businesses can ensure compliance and manage risks more effectively.

### The Team and Culture
With a compact and dedicated team of 14 employees, Covie keeps its operations lean and focused. Their Group Partner is Nan, adding another layer of strategic insight.

### Future Prospects
Currently, Covie is expanding its offerings with features like **Fabric**, which promises to enhance their existing product suite. They emphasize accessibility and integration, highlighting how easy it is to get started—just a quick sign-up.

### Conclusion
In a complex insurance landscape, Covie stands out by simplifying the tools that businesses need to operate smoothly. They are an exciting player in the fintech and health-tech space, continually working to make insurance less of a burden and more of a seamless experience as they evolve.

**For more information, visit [Covie's website](https://www.covie.com)**.
